p: Sulfonium-based ILs, namely ferrocenyl-sulfonium ILs were applied by Venkeret et al. [ 75]. to investigate the effect of the sulphur atom substituent in redox behaviour of the ionic liquid. They reported that electron withdrawing substituents cause a positive shift of the Fe(II)/Fe(III) ferrocene redox potential ( Figure 17). The study concluded that this class of room temperature ionic liquids might be useful as redox mediators for dye-sensitized solar cells (DSSCs), as redox electrolytes in supercapacitors, or as overcharge protection additives in batteries.
